page.title: 17Barrowby Fete.
page.content: On June l5th. l985 The centre of Barrowby was closed to vehicles and a series of stalls and games were set out, the proceeds went towards improving local amenities. The following is made up of extracts from a 10 year old's account of the festivities. "I looked around Stephen's Gutter and there was a lucky dip, a splat the rat and a game where you had to kick a football through some tyres." "After dinner I got brightly dressed as a medieval archer. I paid 25p entrance fee for the fancy dress competition; judged by the Gala Queen." "The man on the loudspeaker said that some races were going to be held. I had a go at the obstacle and running races. I won a sweet in the egg and spoon race."
